features: 【Automatic Rapid Drainage】Our Sponge Holder are sloped and self-draining to help save time on repeated sponge washes, reducing the workload in the kitchen and ensuring that your countertops stay dry and clean.

【Sturdy Bottom Anti-Slip Design】Installing 4 non-slip pads on the bottom of the kitchen caddy to ensure that the sponge caddy is fixed to the surface of the kitchen sink counter and will not fall and move due to the unstable center of gravity, while protecting the kitchen counter from scratches.

【Small Volume】Kitchen sink organizer is suitable for kitchens with limited space. It measures only 8.10"*3.60"*5.50"and can hold a detergent bottle, 2 sponge balls or sink stopper. It fits neatly on your countertop near the sink without taking up too much space and make your kitchen look cleaner.

【Rustproof】Our kitchen sink caddy organizer is made of high-quality stainless steel, and the surface is coated with black paint for secondary protection, effectively preventing rust and deformation. Durable, long-term rust free.

【Satisfactory Guaranteed】 Do Not Hesitate! Click ”Add To Cart” to Level Up Your Kitchen Organization! Kitchen sink caddies can be used as soon as they are received, do not require installation, and are widely used in bathrooms or counters, making them a desirable gift. If you have any questions during this process, please contact us in time and we will solve it for you in time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fits even my Mr. Scrubby
reviews.reviewText: Awesome addition to help keep my kitchen sink organized and clean. This caddy comes in 3 pieces so you can use the taller basket or you can leave it out if you just have smaller items. I really appreciate that the tray is angled to drain and very easy to remove to clean (I do not enjoy emptying trays of accumulated dirty water and debris -- much prefer this method of direct drainage into the sink). It works very well and no issues with liquid catching on the end and running back under the tray -- it drains into the sink only.I wasn't sure if it would fit our Mr. Scrubby sponges (which often don't fit in the in-sink baskets), but it fits 2 of them plus a bottle cleaner and a bottle of soap. So, my scrubby sponges no longer have to just live in the bottom of my sink.Two areas that I wish were a little better:1) I wish the drainage shelf was a little longer than the bottom of the stand so that it would hang just a bit further over the sink. It works as is, but I have to have the bottom of the base right up on the edge of the sink and I am afraid it will tip in if it moves. Which brings me to my second concern.2) I wish there were a more adhesive contact point between the base and the counter (we don't have a little groove for it to sit in like in the company's photos) -- it slides on my countertop. Small suction cups (even on just the back bar of the base) or gel pads I think would have made it more stable. HOWEVER, when I first put the caddy on my sink, it was a little wobbly (base wasn't quite straight out of the package) and it easily slid with any touch, but over the rest of the day it seems to have straightened out with the weight of the items and has a little more grip/friction to the counter as it has sat in one place. So, it isn't as much of an issue as I initially thought it would be right out of the box.I like the caddy and I think it is a great option for my larger Mr. scrubby sponges that often have no place to drain, and I like the design of the angled drain tray. I would not hesitate to recommend this or give it as a gift even, and I actually wish they had a larger version as well to hold even more items that tend to accumulate on the edge of my sink.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I really really like this caddy!
reviews.reviewText: My kitchen sink is metal. Every drop of water shows. Water splashes everywhere, and I swear I spend more time cleaning up the edges of the sink than I do actually washing dishes. I really dislike cluttering up the top of the sink with anything, but do keep a small dishwashing liquid bottle, Powerwash (if you haven't tried Dawn Powerwash DO IT NOW!), and a small bottle of disinfectant hand soap on the sink top. I am forever--forever!--moving them to wipe the water underneath. I debated getting this caddy, wondering if it would really work or would just be one more thing on the countertop that I ended up putting somewhere else. But the price was reasonable, it was just exactly the right size to hold the three items (the hand soap fits perfectly into the little spot designated for brushes), so I ordered. OMG. It is perfect. What is especially great is that any water drip from the items in the caddy falls onto the drip pan and is directed into the sink. If I need to wipe under the caddy, it is ONE THING to pick up, not three. And so far, my attitude is that if I don't see water under it, then I don't need to move it and wipe. I mean, realistically it is just water, and removing the spots once a week seems to work just fine. It looks nice, doesn't take up any more room than the items just sitting there (less actually, because it keep them together), and even Hubby doesn't mind it--he thinks I have some need to put things in boxes and caddies, and I do, IF it helps keep it in one place! AARGH! Anyway, this works beautifully for my needs. It would work for you too. Give it a try. I recommend it without hesitation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It looks exactly like the picture. So if you like the picture and need one, buy it.
reviews.reviewText: This would have been perfect if it was a little deeper to accommodate the brushes that I clean my cast iron skillets with. The brush holder is not deep or tall enough to adequately hold the brushes. I love the sturdiness, the color. I really love that the water from the Caddy flows right into the sink. Because no matter how you squeeze the sponges or shake the brushes there is going to be some water. You don't have to worry about dumping etc. It looks so nice in the kitchen. I did have a problem putting it together. There were no instructions or picture and I had to go online several times to look at the picture. It would help if they just included a picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good, could be a little deeper.
reviews.reviewText: I've grown to dislike caddies that stick to the side of the sink (the suction cups stop sticking) and the drip trays that don't drain (they get stinky). This drains directly into the sink which is great.I could see the design being a little awkward if your sink has the little lip around it. It could also stand to be a bit taller to accommodate longer brushes, but I've made it work. It really is a lot better than the alternatives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps things dry and organized
reviews.reviewText: When a sponge can't drain, it gets so gross. Also, I hate grabbing a cold, soggy sponge. I love this little holder that is perfect for my small sink in my small kitchen. It holds these little things that can end up all over the counter. Since my sink doesn't have a backsplash, this little caddy is essential to keep things organized. Also, because it is designed to drain into the sink, it keeps that area dry. I also love how it looks with this other item I got from Amazon: HarJue Glass Soap Dispenser Set with Marble Tray, Refillable Dish Soap Pump Dispenser, 2×Hand Soap Dispenser https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CNWZD8RG

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The Idea is Good
reviews.reviewText: This item has a couple of design flaws that could be easily fixed. First, if you have an over-mount sink that sticks up significantly, it can be difficult to get this to sit with stability so that it drains into the sink. Adjustable rear legs would fix that issue. The lip of the drain could be longer as well. Finally, the bottom drain piece moves around too easily. They should have made it snap on and off.
